title: Portfolio homepage theme refresh (beige + navy with blue→cyan→teal gradient accents)

requirements.summary: Shift global theme colors to light beige/off-white background with deep navy/dark blue text while preserving existing layout/spacing.
acceptanceCriteria: The site background renders as a light beige/off-white tone (not pure white).
Primary text and headings render in a deep navy/dark blue tone with readable contrast on the beige background.
No changes to section order, spacing scale, or overall layout structure (including hero text-left / photo-right).

file_operations.description: Adjust global CSS color tokens (e.g., background/foreground/primary/muted/border) to achieve a light beige/off-white backdrop and deep navy text, keeping all spacing/layout utilities intact.
Ensure Tailwind theme continues to map to the updated CSS variables cleanly (no layout/spacing changes), keeping typography readable against the new beige background.
Update only background-related classes if needed so the global app background reflects the new beige theme without changing structure/section order/spacing.

requirements.summary: Define a single consistent Blue→Cyan→Teal gradient accent and constrain gradient usage to hero decorative shapes, CTA buttons, and highlight/stat cards only.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent Blue→Cyan→Teal gradient style is used across the homepage wherever gradients appear.
Gradients are visible on hero background shapes and do not appear as general page/section backgrounds outside the hero decorative elements.
CTA buttons use the gradient accent (at least the primary CTA), with hover/focus states that remain professional and accessible.
Highlight/stat presentation elements (e.g., the hero floating stat card and/or metric emphasis) use the gradient accent; regular content cards elsewhere do not gain gradient fills by default.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust a single reusable Blue→Cyan→Teal gradient utility (and hover/focus variants) and remove/replace existing non-allowed gradient usages (e.g., section-wide gradient backgrounds/separators and card-hover gradient borders) with non-gradient alternatives so gradients remain limited to hero shapes, CTA buttons, and highlight/stat cards.

Remove or replace section-level decorative gradient utilities (e.g., any gradient-based subtle background or separator) so non-hero sections no longer introduce gradient backgrounds; preserve section padding/structure/spacing exactly.
Replace the timeline gradient stroke/fill styling with a solid (non-gradient) theme-consistent style while preserving the existing timeline layout and spacing.

Apply the Blue→Cyan→Teal gradient accent ONLY to hero decorative background shapes and the hero highlight/stat card presentation; keep the rest of the hero background non-gradient aside from these decorative elements. Use existing shadcn/ui components (Button, Card, Badge) via className overrides only (do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply the gradient accent ONLY to the primary CTA button styling (e.g., navbar Contact Me) with accessible hover/focus states. Use the existing shadcn/ui Button via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply the gradient accent to the contact form primary submit CTA button (and its hover/focus states) while keeping all other contact cards/links non-gradient. Use existing shadcn/ui Button/Card/Input components via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update Hero content to show the specified name/title and add the specified tagline while preserving hero layout and CTA labels.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero displays the exact name "Riya Tyagi" and the exact title "Data Analytics & Data Science Professional".
Hero displays the exact tagline "Turning data into actionable insights" as a distinct line of text (not only implied in other sections).
CTA button texts remain exactly: "View Portfolio", "Download Resume", "Contact Me".

file_operations.description: Insert the exact tagline "Turning data into actionable insights" as a prominent, distinct line in the hero text block while preserving the existing text-left/image-right layout and keeping CTA button labels unchanged. Use existing shadcn/ui components (Button, Badge, Card) as-is via props/className only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the navbar brand/name remains "Riya Tyagi" and continues to scroll to the home section with existing behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Refresh homepage component styling to a minimal, modern, recruiter-friendly look with rounded cards, soft shadows, and polished hover/focus states (no excessive gradients).
acceptanceCriteria: Cards and interactive elements use rounded corners and soft, consistent shadows (no harsh/neon effects).
Hover/focus states feel polished and consistent with the new theme (including buttons and prominent cards).
Overall aesthetic reads as professional and recruiter-friendly (no overly saturated backgrounds, excessive gradients, or playful styling).

file_operations.description: Tune shared utility classes (e.g., premium-card hover, shadows, borders, focus-visible ring behavior) to be softer and more consistent with a professional beige+navy theme, ensuring no gradients are introduced beyond the allowed gradient-accent utilities.

Adjust card and badge className usage to align with the refreshed modern styling (rounded corners, soft shadows, refined hover) without adding gradients to regular content cards. Use existing shadcn/ui Card/Badge components via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine card and badge styling for a cleaner modern look (consistent rounding/shadows/hover), ensuring no gradient fills are applied to regular content cards. Use existing shadcn/ui Card/Badge components via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update card/icon container styling (shadows, borders, muted backgrounds) to match the new theme and modern aesthetic; keep content and layout unchanged. Use existing shadcn/ui Card components via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align the certification highlight card styling with the updated modern theme (soft shadow, rounded edges) while keeping structure/content unchanged and avoiding gradients. Use existing shadcn/ui Card components via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update footer background/border/text/link styling to match the beige+navy theme and modern tone (no gradients), preserving layout and content.

requirements.summary: Preserve existing navbar behavior (active section highlighting, smooth scrolling, responsiveness) while updating styling to match the new theme.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar still highlights the active section and maintains smooth scrolling to sections.
Navbar remains readable against the new background and matches the updated theme without breaking responsiveness (desktop and mobile).

file_operations.description: Update navbar colors (background blur state, active/hover styles, borders) to match beige+navy theme while keeping active-section tracking, smooth scrolling logic, and responsive mobile menu behavior unchanged. Use the existing shadcn/ui Button via className overrides only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
If needed, adjust global focus-visible ring and muted/foreground tokens so navbar text, active states, and overlays remain readable and accessible on the new beige background.
